russia_1725_peter_death.headline: Death of Peter the Great
russia_1725_peter_death.description: Peter I dies, leaving Russian Academy of Sciences to seek stability through European recruitment
russia_1725_peter_death.impact_on_science: Increased recruitment of foreign mathematicians and scientists

france_1715_louis_death.headline: Death of Louis XIV
france_1715_louis_death.description: End of Sun King's reign brings new intellectual openness under Regency
france_1715_louis_death.impact_on_science: Greater intellectual freedom and scientific patronage

austria_1740_succession.headline: War of Austrian Succession Begins
austria_1740_succession.description: Maria Theresa's succession triggers European conflict, affecting university funding
austria_1740_succession.impact_on_science: Disrupted academic positions and reduced patronage in affected regions

prussia_1740_frederick.headline: Frederick the Great Becomes King
prussia_1740_frederick.description: Frederick II ascends throne, establishes Berlin Academy and promotes mathematics
prussia_1740_frederick.impact_on_science: Major patronage of mathematics and philosophy, attracts European scholars

france_1789_revolution.headline: French Revolution Begins
france_1789_revolution.description: Revolutionary upheaval transforms French Academy and scientific institutions
france_1789_revolution.impact_on_science: Radical restructuring of French Academy, persecution of nobility including scientists

england_1687_newton.headline: Newton's Principia Published
england_1687_newton.description: Mathematical revolution establishes England as center of natural philosophy
england_1687_newton.impact_on_science: Establishes mathematical physics and attracts European scholars to study Newtonian methods
